tweet: The Endangered Species Act has protected wildlife for more than four decades. I stand with the many constituents who have contacted my office to defend the Endangered Species Act, and I will continue to stand up for the animals and ecosystems that are the heart of our Desert.

The CDC is continuing to advise consumers to avoid romaine lettuce from the Central Coastal growing regions of northern and central California due to the E. coli outbreak. Remember: if you don’t know where the romaine is from, don’t eat it!  https://www.cdc.gov/ecoli/2018/o157h7-11-18/index.html?fbclid=IwAR11KORHEzpW0JQikNGySLs14Ypjd8eCPwIW-VSAioAk3NJl8nsJWaX6NW8 …

For Jackson and his family, telemedicine means avoiding expensive travel costs and hours spent in waiting rooms. For rural and isolated communities, telemedicine can be the cheapest and most effective way to get lifesaving care!

The CDC has issued an E. coli warning for romaine lettuce and is recommending that consumers throw away all of their romaine lettuce, and avoid it until we have more information on this outbreak. E. coli infections are serious and can be life-threatening.  https://www.cdc.gov/ecoli/2018/o157h7-11-18/index.html …

I am proud to have helped secure more than $1.3 million in funding for Independent Living Partnership, so they can continue to provide free rides in our communities. Everyone should enjoy the freedom and empowerment of living independently! https://bit.ly/2OUehvD

I want to thank all those who took time out of their day yesterday and during early voting to cast a ballot and participate in our elections. I am honored to continue serving as your voice and your advocate in Washington and here at home.

Election Day is here, and no matter who you support, I hope you will go out to the polls to exercise your fundamental right to vote. Our nation is strongest when everyone is engaged in the political process! https://www.desertsun.com/story/news/2018/11/06/california-election-day-updates-where-vote-2018-midterms/1897995002/ …

Scam alert! Scammers can trick your caller ID and are claiming they will help you increase your monthly payment if you give them your SSN. Don’t be fooled! Click here to learn more and stay safe! https://www.consumer.ftc.gov/blog/2018/10/hang-spoofed-ssa-calls …
